meanings.definition: Showing a brooding ill humor or silent resentment; morose or sulky.
meanings.sent1: After losing the game, he wore his sullenest expression.
meanings.sent2: She was at her sullenest when asked to do chores.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a sullenest meow when denied treats.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered in the sullenest manner, foretelling heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: His sullenest mood cast a shadow over the party.

meanings.definition: Having a gloomy or threatening appearance.
meanings.sent1: The abandoned house had the sullenest look on the street.
meanings.sent2: The forest at night can appear sullenest to some.
meanings.sent3: The sullenest sky made the children think a storm was coming.
meanings.sent4: The old castle stood on the hill with a sullenest presence.
meanings.sent5: The painting depicted a sullenest landscape with dark colors.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or indicative of gloom.
meanings.sent1: The movie had the sullenest atmosphere, setting a somber tone.
meanings.sent2: His sullenest outlook on life affected those around him.
meanings.sent3: The sullenest weather ruined their plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent4: The news of the accident cast a sullenest mood over the town.
meanings.sent5: The empty streets had a sullenest feel under the dim streetlights.
